intro: Lantana trifolia var. geminata, commonly known as the twinleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its opposite, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is a shrub or subshrub, typically growing to a height of 30–60 cm. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it adaptable to various garden environments. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and vegetative means make it a common ornamental plant in many regions.
